question: 1. Which of the following statements are correct about a binary tree?

answers.a: A node in a binary tree can have exactly two children
answers.b: A node in a binary tree can have atmost two children
answers.c: A node in a binary tree can have two or more children
answers.d: A node in a binary tree can have two or more children

question: 2. Node values in a binary tree always appear in a sorted order from root to leaf, going left to right at each level.
3. Which of the following is TRUE about the leaf nodes of a binary tree?

answers.a: Leaf nodes in a binary tree have no children
answers.b: Atleast one leaf node in a binary tree has two chidren
answers.c: Leaf nodes in a binary tree are allowed to have more than two children
answers.d: Leaf nodes in a binary tree may or may not have child nodes

question: 4. In a binary search tree all nodes in the left subtree are __________.
5. What is the worst case height possible in a binary search tree? Let N be the number of nodes in the tree.
